reviewText: The stars of the Mighty Ducks seriesshould all reunite to make more sequelswith the following plot lines:D4: Forget Iceland! The Mighty Ducks playhockey against a steroid pumped team fromcommunist Cuba and show that democracy isstill #1!D5: The Mighty Ducks have defeated everyteam on earth. But what will happen whenthey are forced by alien invaders to playhockey for the survival of our planet......in outer space!?!?!D6: Can The Mighty Ducks stave off a teamof mass produced artificially intelligentrobots programmed to replicate the movesof the greatest hockey players in historyincluding...The Ducks themselves!?!?!D7: Sure no team has ever beaten the Ducks,but what happens when they are challengedby THEMSELVES when a mad scientist createsevil clones of each player!?!D8: In the year 2168 the Mighty Ducks rulethe world, and so everything is as it shouldbe. But when a time-travelling villain decidesto challenge their reign by eradicating hockeyfrom ever being invented, can our heroes teachour our founding fathers to play hockey andsave our nation's second national passtimebefore it's too late!?!?!?!D9: Back To The Pond.When a greedy attorney leaves the duckspenniless in the twilight of their lives,one last tournament for charity at a localretirement village will prove if the ducksstill have that special something that cannever be taken away: hockey.These movies would teach kids of all agesabout science, history, corporate ethics,the importance of exercice, and the powerto realize the Canadian dream (to makeit as a hockey star).

reviewText: I was originally gonna order just D2 but my mom ordered all 3 in 1 boxset. I will individually review each film in chronological order.D12nd one I watched after I saw D2. I learned that my favorite character is Charlie Conway (Jersey #96). He was a born captain. The team is very terible at the sport of hockey and don't even have correct equipment. So if Gordan Bombay (Emilio Estevez) names the team after his boss, Gerald Ducksworth, he will give the team $10,000 for equipment. The name Ducks comes in at that point. Ducksworth cancels Gordon's community service to coach the team but quits his old job as a lawyer to keep coaching the Ducks. Tied with D3 for favorite.D2Favorite film. Takes place a couple years after D1. Gordon comes back from minor leauge but ends when his knee is injured. A man offers Gordon to become coach for Team U.S.A in the Junior Goodwill Games. We loose a few characters, but we are introduced to new characters. Luis Mendoza, incredible skater but can't stop. Dwane Robertson, pro stick-handler. Ken Wu, sly on skates. Dean Portman, heavy hitter. Russ Tyler, knuckepuck. Fulton and Portman form a little group called the Bash Brothers (Ken joins at the final game). The new symbol of the Ducks is unvield. This symbol is used in D3, and the cartoon series.D3Final film made before sold to the NHL. The film takes place in the team's late teen years. Gordon promotes Charlie to team captain while he goes to work for the hockey division of the Goodwill Games. The team goes to a dorm school called Eden Hall. Thier "new" coach Pat Orion, strips Charlie of his position of captain. The team is recalled the Warriors. If any of you true NHL fans know, the logo for the Warriors is the symbol for the Chicago Blackhawks. Charlie meets a girl called Linda who has never seen a hockey game. Charlie blows the first game for his team with a tie when he tries to score from the blue line. For the first time, he is thrown into the box for unsportsmanlike conduct (he crashed his stick into the goal net). Bad news being Hans (in D2 called "Jan") passes away. Bombay lays a green jersey from the first film on his casket telling the team "Every time you touch the ice, remember it was Hans who taught us to fly". After a bit of trouble. The Ducks take on the varsity Warriors in a grudge match. Adam Banks was moved to Varsity. After a nogociation Adam is moved back to the Ducks for the JV Varsity Showdown. The team is recalled the Ducks. The first 2 periods go out pointless. In the final period with only 10 seconds, Goldberg (who lost goalie) shoots earning the win for the Ducks. The team is now called Eden Hall Mighty Ducks.There are no more Ducks movies in production and this is all you can get movie-wise. On Ducksshirts.com, you can get T-shirts of the 1st green Jersey of one of the characters. So that's it. I recomend it for any Ducks fan.

reviewText: "The Mighty Ducks" boasts a legendary trilogy of movies that feature young hockey players learning how to survive life's lessons through teamwork and by the guidance of their coach Gordon Bombay.  The series' three live-action films were released throughout the 1990s by Walt Disney Pictures; the popularity of the fictional team went on to inspire the creation of a real-life NHL team, the Anaheim Ducks. Critical response to the films has been meager, yet, even today, the movies remain some of the most popular sports/motivational works on the market.Starring roles for all three movies include:  Emilio Estevez as Gordon Bombay Joshua Jackson as Charlie Conway, Elden Henson as Fulton Reed, Shaun Weiss as Greg Goldberg, Matt Doherty as Les Averman, Garette Ratliff Henson as Guy Germaine, Marguerite Moreau as Connie Moreau, and Vincent Larusso as Adam Banks.  Two of the original characters were dropped in the second movie, but later reprised in the third:  Heidi Kling as Casey Conway and Joss Ackland as Hans.  "D2" casted several new characters who were brought back in the third movie:  Colombe Jacobsen as Julie Gaffney, Ty O'Neal as Dwayne Robertson, Kenan Thompson as Russ Tyler, Aaron Lohr as Dean Portman, Mike Vitar as Luis Mendoza, Justin Wong as Ken Wu, and Scott Whyte as Gunnar Stahl.Cameo appearances are made in all three movies:  Mike Modano, and Basil McRae (D1); Kristi Yamaguchi, Greg Louganis, Bob Miller, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Chris Chelios, Cam Neely, Luc Robitaille, and Wayne Gretzky (D2); Paul Kariya (D3)..  UNIFYING THEMES:1.)  Elaborate plays such as the "Flying V."2.)  The Ducks are always the underdogs, further symbolized by the number of minority players on the team; the other teams are always a uniform race/gender.3.)  In the final game of the movie, the Ducks will always eke out a win by a solitary, last-minute goal.4.)  When facing their rival team, no penalties for unsportsmanlike play will ever be charged against the Ducks' opponent.5.)  The team never starts out as "The Ducks;" in every movie, they originate under another team name but then revert to "The Ducks" as an extra boost of power for the climax..  SUMMARIES:1.)  "The Mighty Ducks"--To atone for a DUI, Gordon Bombay is ordered to perform community service; he is assigned a coaching gig with the hopeless little league hockey team, District 5.  It doesn't take long for District 5's team of `left-overs' to discover Bombay's history with the Hawks--the team that still reigns as the biggest and baddest in the league.  Recognizing much of his younger self in the team (especially in Charlie Conway), Bombay commits himself to the cause by supplying District 5 with useable gear and skills; the kids pay tribute to Bombay's boss, Gerald Ducksworth, by adopting "The Ducks" as their new team name.  With their new lease on hockey, the Ducks soar into the finals and even take on a new flock-member, Adam Banks (an ex-Hawk).  The league final challenges the Ducks to face their fears against the Hawks; even Coach Bombay must now stand up against his old coach, Jack Reilly.  The game comes down to team captain Charlie Conway's penalty shot where, like Bombay, he must prove he can lead his team against all odds.2.)  "D2:  The Mighty Ducks"--When a knee injury ends Gordon Bombay's career with the Minnehaha Waves, Bombay returns to coaching and puts together a team to compete on the international level at the Junior Goodwill Games.  Several members of the Ducks unite with other top hockey players from around the country to form Team USA.  Their new-found fame and Bombay's `win-only' attitude becomes disastrous for the team's moral.  It takes a few hard-earned lessons (and a new player) from a street hockey team to turn Bombay's group of scattered divas into a tight-knit force--one that bests Team Iceland in the finals.3.)  "D3:  The Mighty Ducks"--Charlie Conway and teammates follow in the footsteps of a young Gordon Bombay by accepting scholarships to Eden Hall Academy, a top-ranked Minnesota high school.  The Ducks have a hard time fitting in with their new classmates, and even more difficulty playing for a new coach, Ted Orion; Charlie dismisses Orion and quits the team.  A little guidance from ex-Coach Bombay sets Charlie straight, allowing him to finally learn the lessons Orion had been trying to teach.  Despite being the junior varsity team, the Ducks manage to pull one over on the varsity boys for an unlikely win.

reviewText: I remember watching the first film as a child, and it loved it. The other two I'm sure I watched but forgot the stories. My children love hockey and play hockey so they loved all these films. It's just some of those great 80's style/early 90's "corny" movies!You can however pick up the "agenda 21" idea's Disney & the NHL were trying to pass to us (pun intended). Their (NHL) agenda I think was to expand the sport and get people of all backgrounds interested in hockey. Disney's agenda however is as it always is, i'll leave it to you to research.If your children play any sport where their team/club doesn't have a winning tradition or are struggling in a season, having them watch this film may give them a mental push! Just don't have them watch with the intent that they may learn ANYTHING about playing hockey! These films are just fun, corny, and possibly inspirational (as most sports films are meant to be).
summary: If your Children love hockey this is great!

reviewText: Everything about the Mighty Ducks is pretty much good. The characters, the plot, and even the music these movies are great. Though the Mighty Ducks are Disney films, they contain enough content to push a PG-13 rating. Still though, teens and adults should like these movies whether you are an ice hockey fan or not. Yes, the Mighty Ducks is mainly about ice hockey but all three do a good job focusing on the characters. I know that some people didn't give good reviews for the third movie but I think that was because it didn't quite carry the "victory hype" of the first two. Also, the third Mighty Ducks film is a bit different in the sense that it shows how the hardships of life and the bad decisions that follow can have an impact on the other people around you. Plus, the message of the third movie is that change happens throughout life and you must learn how to deal with it. So to sum all of that up, don't expect the 3rd movie to be exactly similar with the first two but do keep an open mind when viewing because the Mighty Ducks 3 is good for what it is. Without question, Mighty Ducks 3 ends the trilogy. I still wish that a 4th movie had been made following the events of the last movie.  By the way, I suggest getting the soundtracks for the 2nd and 3rd Mighty Ducks. It's ashame the first movie didn't have a soundtrack.

reviewText: If you're looking for a film series that's fun to watch, has a good cast, and leaves you with a warm tingly feeling all over, than I'd reccomend this one.  Emilio Estevez, and later Jeffrey Nordling, led a group of diverse pre-teens (and later, teenagers) through the trials and tribilations that come with becoming elete hockey players...and surviving life in general.  Just over five hours long, this film series is a joy for anyone (mainly kids, but anyone who just wants to see underdogs win and come out on top) to sit back and enjoy.  It's a bit like the Globe Trotters on ice as you laugh at the team's antics both on and off the ice.  And, of course, the theme music, which is appropriately present in all three films, will stick itself into your brain and remain there for a lifetime, leaving you stuck with these DVDs for as long.  So just go out and buy them already.

reviewText: I purchased this DVD boxset in November and just now got around to watching them. I have been a long time fan of The Mighty Ducks movies and used to watch them all the time on TV and on VHS. I was happy they were on DVD for me to purchase. They came at a great price too...I believe I paid $20.99. That is awesome considering each movie retails at $10 to $14 each. As for the films themselves, all 3 are presented in their original aspect ratio, 1.85:1 widescreen. I only gave this collection 3 stars as I am not a huge fan of D3: The Mighty Ducks. In my opinion, it's a sequel that never should've been made. It lacks the same magical formula that made the first 2 films so great. The movie feels rushed and it seems to push Joshua Jackson too much into the spotlight. He was never the lead star, Emilio Estevez was always the true star in my eyes. I recommend this boxset if you're a fan of the movies.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Buena Vista (the company that releases Disney films on DVD) chose to not release anamorphic DVDs when they first came to DVD, so none of these films are anamorphically enhanced. This means, if you have a widescreen television, you will have black bars on all four sides of the picture. Also, these discs are absolutely barebones, only featuring a Dolby 2.0 soundtrack and a 1.85:1 widescreen presentation. Where are the extras?! I don't know about you guys, but I am a Mighty Duck fan who is disappointed by the DVD releases of these films.
Title: N/A
